Mobile

issue.body:
This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

---

### Внимание

Эта проблема решается с помощью расширения [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra).

Если вы используете AdGuard для Windows, Mac или Android, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что AdGuard Extra включен в настройках программы.

Если вы используете браузерное расширение AdGuard, мы рекомендуем установить AdGuard Extra в дополнение к нему.

* [Установить в Chrome, Edge или другой браузер на основе Chromium](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Установить в Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.dell.com/community/s/html/assets/category-board-post-pages-banner.png](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dell.com%2Fcommunity%2Fs%2Fhtml%2Fassets%2Fcategory-board-post-pages-banner.png) ### Comment Username: `@backforeground` > Missing scrollbars for image - Web Annoyances Ultralist > > Firefox 104.0.2 x64 English. > > > Adguard Version 4.1.22 - the only extension installed on Firefox. > > All filters/rules = off except - Web Annoyances Ultralist > No updates were find when checking for udpates and Web Annoyances Ultralist was enabled and the parent Annoyances was enabled. > > > Zoom in on the image: > https://www.dell.com/community/s/html/assets/category-board-post-pages-banner.png > > When zooming in on the image, or shrinking the Firefox window, > the horizontal scrollbars are not present (are missing) when the image is bigger than the window, because of the Adguard Web Annoyances Ultralist rules. > > The scrollbars show up when Adguard is disabled and dissapear when it's enabled. > > I think I saw the error before on other images, but I'm not sure. > > The filter works with uBlock Origin, But for example uBlock Origin doesn't block youtube ads properly and AdGuard blocks them. > > https://cdn.staticaly.com/gh/yourduskquibbles/webannoyances/master/ultralist.txt > Works inside > uBlock Origin v1.21.2 - default settings + Web Annoyances Ultralist - only Extension enabled > > uBlock Origin 1.44.4 - works with the latest version of uBlock Origin. ### Screenshots

Web Annoyances Ultralist

comment.body:
`Web Annoyances Ultralist` it's a third-party filter list and it's not maintained by us, so it would be better to report this issue here - https://github.com/yourduskquibbles/webannoyances/issues

It seems that it's caused by this rule:
```adblock
bartamanpatrika.com,blog.google,brainly.*,cbsnews.com,cnbc.com,creditcards.chase.com,dell.com,federalnewsnetwork.com,fedex.com,giftcardgranny.com,glamour.com,gq.com,journals.sagepub.com,just-auto.com,just-drinks.com,just-food.com,just-style.com,lowes.com,newrepublic.com,parenting.com,pitchfork.com,powerhungry.com,ruralsprout.com,taxact.com,thebalance.com,thebalancecareers.com,thebalanceeveryday.com,thebalancesmb.com,tiktok.com,washingtonpost.com,whoisxmlapi.com,wired.com#$#html { overflow-x: hidden !important; }
```
so as a temporary solution, please add this rule:
```adblock
dell.com#@$#html { overflow-x: hidden !important; }
```
to user rules.

<hr>

>The filter works with uBlock Origin

In this case, it rather looks like that this rule doesn't work with uBlock Origin.
If I'm not wrong, uBlock Origin doesn't apply element hiding/CSS rules if "website" is just an image, but AdGuard does, hence the difference.

<hr>

@yourduskquibbles Could you please take a look?

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.dell.com/community/s/html/assets/category-board-post-pages-banner.png](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dell.com%2Fcommunity%2Fs%2Fhtml%2Fassets%2Fcategory-board-post-pages-banner.png) ### Comment Username: `@backforeground` > Missing scrollbars for image - Web Annoyances Ultralist > > Firefox 104.0.2 x64 English. > > > Adguard Version 4.1.22 - the only extension installed on Firefox. > > All filters/rules = off except - Web Annoyances Ultralist > No updates were find when checking for udpates and Web Annoyances Ultralist was enabled and the parent Annoyances was enabled. > > > Zoom in on the image: > https://www.dell.com/community/s/html/assets/category-board-post-pages-banner.png > > When zooming in on the image, or shrinking the Firefox window, > the horizontal scrollbars are not present (are missing) when the image is bigger than the window, because of the Adguard Web Annoyances Ultralist rules. > > The scrollbars show up when Adguard is disabled and dissapear when it's enabled. > > I think I saw the error before on other images, but I'm not sure. > > The filter works with uBlock Origin, But for example uBlock Origin doesn't block youtube ads properly and AdGuard blocks them. > > https://cdn.staticaly.com/gh/yourduskquibbles/webannoyances/master/ultralist.txt > Works inside > uBlock Origin v1.21.2 - default settings + Web Annoyances Ultralist - only Extension enabled > > uBlock Origin 1.44.4 - works with the latest version of uBlock Origin. ### Screenshots

issue.title: dzen.ru

labels.name: Extra
labels.description: Issues, related to AdGuard Extra extension

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

---

### Внимание

Эта проблема решается с помощью расширения [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra).

Если вы используете AdGuard для Windows, Mac или Android, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что AdGuard Extra включен в настройках программы.

Если вы используете браузерное расширение AdGuard, мы рекомендуем установить AdGuard Extra в дополнение к нему.

* [Установить в Chrome, Edge или другой браузер на основе Chromium](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Установить в Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
Не повторяется с вашими настройками.
Попробуйте выключить и снова включить контент-блокеры в настройках Сафари, а также обновить фильтры Адгарда.
Важно не закрывать окно Адгарда при обновлении фильтров в течение ~60 секунд, иначе iOS прервёт процесс применения фильтров.

comment.body:
@Alex-302 первый четыре правила и последнее бесполезны, так как что с ними включёнными, что только с двумя оставшимися
```
zoom.us#%#AG_onLoad(function() {var b=new MutationObserver(function() {var c=document.querySelector('#onetrust-accept-btn-handler'); c&&(b.disconnect(),c.click()) });b.observe(document, {childList: !0,subtree: !0});setTimeout(function() {b.disconnect()}, 1E4)});
@@||cdn.cookielaw.org/scripttemplates/otSDKStub.js$domain=zoom.us
```
эффект тот же самый — при первом открытии сайта галочка недоступна, а при перезагрузке страницы она становится доступной (проверял каждый раз при изменении правила в новом окне инкогнито).

Но при этом вы зачем-то разрешаете все cookie, даже рекламные:

![Screenshot 2022-09-28 at 15 17 50](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19418601/192776633-9f25cd17-246f-4f0b-a6a5-716ebad922df.png)

Можно ли сделать так, чтобы при первой загрузке страницы галочка была доступна и рекламные куки не были разрешены?

comment.body:
К сожалению, мы не можем воспроизвести проблему с вашими настройками.

1. Зайдите, пожалуйста, в настройки > Safari > расширения, отключите все расширения AdGuard и включите снова.
2. Зайдите в приложение AdGuard и обновите фильтры, подождите 2-3 минуты не закрывая приложение.
3. Перезагрузите устройство
4. Зайдите на этот сайт и проверьте наличие рекламы, ее быть не должно.

У меня регистрация не работает, только через гугл захожу. Проверь с такими правилами
```
||zoom.us^$cookie=_zm_fingerprint
||zoom.us^$cookie=_zm_ssid
||zoom.us^$cookie=_zm_visitor_guid
||zoom.us^$cookie=_zm_ctaid

zoom.us#%#AG_onLoad(function() {var b=new MutationObserver(function() {var c=document.querySelector('#onetrust-accept-btn-handler'); c&&(b.disconnect(),c.click()) });b.observe(document, {childList: !0,subtree: !0});setTimeout(function() {b.disconnect()}, 1E4)});
@@||cdn.cookielaw.org/scripttemplates/otSDKStub.js$domain=zoom.us
zoom.us#@##onetrust-consent-sdk
```

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://sharpspring.com/activate](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fsharpspring.com%2Factivate) ### Comment Username: @PsychoFox11 > The tracking filter is blocking forms provided from SharpSpring by Constant Contact, on Windows. Edge was listed but it occurs in Chrome etc. as well. The example is on their own page, but affects forms of all customers using Constant Contact's SharpSpring product as well, in turn affecting a large number of sites. > If the intention is to block tracking, it should block ss.js but but not form.js - however it seems to block both currently. > The rules that EasyList use properly block tracking, but not the forms. > See the EasyList tracking blocking rules here, and look for the domain 'marketingautomation.services': > https://easylist.to/easylist/easyprivacy.txt > As this is affecting the sits of many Constant Contact customers using this product, it would be very helpful if the forms were not blocked along with the tracking. The form.js script cannot track if the cookie was not generated by ss.js, so blocking only ss.js should prevent the tracking while allowing forms. ### Screenshots

comment.body:
Unfortunately, we can't reproduce the problem with your settings.

1. Please go to settings > Safari > extensions, disable all AdGuard extensions and enable them again.
2. Go to the AdGuard app and update the filters, wait 2-3 minutes without closing the app.
3. Reboot your device
4. Go to this site and check for ads, there shouldn't be any.
